The initial seizures of Stanley and the island of South Georgia (a scenario that includes the Argentine corvette the Guerrico, the first Ship in LnL!) are also featured, as are two what-if scenarios that depict an opposed British landing at San Carlos and a last-ditch fight on the outskirts of Stanley.

Accompanied by Harrier and Pucara Strikes and plenty of artillery, Argentine Conscripts, Marines and Amphibious Commandos take on British Paras, Royal Marines and Gurkhas for the bleak, windswept islands of the South Atlantic, in historical battles that fit perfectly with the LnL Tactical Gaming System.

This game is no longer available, the new, improved and expanded edition can be found in Lock 'n Load Tactical: Heroes of the Falklands
20596.name: Lock 'n Load: A Ring of Hills

20597.name: Jack's a loss
20597.description:
This is a game a lot like the game 'Hera and Zeus' but you use playing cards.
Each player receives 9 cards to start off the top of the draw deck. They are placed in front of themselves in a row, upside down, making sure that there is a gap between the two rows.
During the game, battles take place to see what cards get removed and which don't (higher cards beat the lower cards(except '2' beats 'ace', seeing as nothing else does!)).
You can have up to five rows by nine columns. This creates a reserves system. That creates a bluff mechanic.
The game ends when two jacks, or the jack of hearts is destroyed by the opposing player.

There is also a 1 player version, where there is a default of nine cards placed alternately face up and face down. You do this as well, but yours are all face up. The rules are now the same, except for some other things, that are mentioned in the rules.

20598.name: Lifesaver Game
20598.description: The Lifesaver Game provides a comfortable setting for parents to instruct children about the importance of safety and how to avoid dangerous situations. Children today live in a very active and sophisticated world. As a result, they need to know how to react to emergency situations. The best way to teach children is to make it fun. In the game, children and adults are asked safety questions and parents are encouraged to help the child get the correct answer. The child is rewarded with Lifesaver tokens for each correct answer. They could win a penny, five cents, a hug, a "stay up 1/2 later" token, etc. Honoring the tokens makes the family fun last long after the game is over. It also motivates children to play the game again and again, thus reinforcing principles of safety.

20599.name: Witch of Elsmea
20599.description:
Elsmea, another world of warlocks and witches.
You are high school students at Academy of Witches.
A half year before graduation, doctress Diana invite all of you into her lab. "Welcome and congratulations, my bewitched girls!" She says " You are elected as candidates for the most valuable witch". Then, the elfin doctress adds niceties with gorgeous grin. "Only one of you will be laurelled as the Witch of Elsmea of the year. The winner should read ambitious message at graduation. Questions? "
"Doc," One of you say "what is standard for the examination?"
The instructor witch winks. "People of Elsmea know the way. They need fetishes or magick items for their poor lives. Go ahead and make their days happy! Class is dismissed."

Yes. Like the legendary witch who made glass shoes, pumpkin coach and mouse-coachmen for Cendrillon, you must create and use or give some magick items for citizen of Elsmea. Every 3rd month, doctresses check the folks' Favors of each region about you, and fill in report cards as Brownie Points (BP). Who can be the best? At the end of 6 months, the player scored highest BP win a game as the Witch of Elsmea!

To create fetishes, you must collect and fuse elements(clear colored beads) from all over the Elsmea (Game-map).
But your rivals aim same thing. And fusional process is static. Thus to win, you must control all things!

20600.name: Smack-A-Roo
20600.description:
Smack-A-Roo is a fun family game that is actually 10 games in one: Baseball, Smack-It, Skeebol, Knockoff, Bowlaround, Duck Zoop, 6 Lil’ Indians, Impossi-Bowl, Clownaround, and Shoot the Works. Some of these titles reveal the type of game: “Baseball,” “Bowlaround,” and “Impossi-Bowl,” are all pretty clear, for instance. Other titles are Ideal’s proprietary titles for games or variations that they have devised for this unique “arena-style” playing board. It’s all explained in the instruction booklet, which illustrates how to play each game. Gameplay is kind of a mix of Skittle Pool, Zig Zag Zoom, and Rebound or Bumper Shot.

There is a cool little marble-shooter gadget and marbles, of course. There are other gadgets and equipment, too: tenpins for bowling games, a triangular pin-setting device, a spinner device and an abstract clown used as challenging obstacles during play, and a sidelines bat for baseball-type games. Any number of people can play—including solo (which isn’t much fun, however)—but Smack-A-Roo is best suited for 2 to 4 players.

20601.name: La Legion
20601.description:
From 1907 to 1927 Spain fought in Morocco a long war, full of ups and downs, brilliant victories and crashing defeats that touched the Spanish society.
In 1909, after the disaster at the Ravine of the Wolf, the war became headline news at the same time as the "Tragic Week" in Barcelona. The Franco-Spanish treaty of 1912 gave Spain the zone of the Protectorate, that Spain started to occupy from Ceuta, Melilla and Larache.
In spite of the resistance of the Moroccan leaders El Raisuni and Abd-El-Krim, the troops of General Berenguer slowly conquered the rebel territories. In 1921, the General Silvestre suffers in Annual a crunching defeat where 13000 soldiers died and Melilla was left vulnerable to the enemy.
In 1925, General primo de Rivera disembarked in Alhucemas, defeated Abd-El-Krim and achieved the end of the Pacification of the Protectorate. In 1926 the war in Africa ended. (Translation from the back cover)

20602.name: Rejseholdet
20602.description:
A murder has been committed and the local police call for back-up. In complicated cases it's never easy to find the killer.
In this game you get the opportunity to test you skills as a police investigator. Interrogation, gathering of evidence and finding the right suspect is all in a good days work for the special murder investigation force.

20603.name: Taxi and the city
20603.description: Taxi and the city seems to be (according to the information of the publisher) a new line of games, in which the players try to earn the most money by working as a taxi-driver in a certain city during the agreed playtime. Right now it is only available concerning the German city 'Wiesbaden', but others are planned.

20605.description:
This book contains, as the title implies, the rules of 100 games that can be played on a chessboard. It includes chess and draughts variants, designer games like Focus and Laska, traditional games and puzzles.
ISBN 0720606179
20605.name: 100 Other Games to Play on a Chessboard

20606.name: Techmate
20606.description: Each player controls a team of robots. The player that can transport his robots into his opponents' starting spaces first wins.

20607.name: No Time to Waste
20607.description:
"No time to waste" is a cooperative trivia-game. The central piece of the game is a clock with an arrow that starts at 12 o'clock, and than starts moving clock-wise, taking exactly an hour for one turn. Surrounding the clock are tiles that are face down at the start of the game, but that are turned up during the game (showing colorful pictures of nature) if the players succeed in answering trivia questions about environmental topics. The clock-arrow indicates how well the players are doing because if the tile-turning is ahead of the arrow the players are doing well, but if they are behind they are in trouble!
Other trouble for the players comes from wrong answers, because after a wrong answer a red card has to be turned over, which may mean that the Greenpeace ship is blocked. In case of a blockade progress on the dial is stopped (but the clock moves on!). Luckily good answers not only turn over tiles, but also give players green card that they can use to remove blockades.
The game is cooperative because everyone wins if the last tile is turned over, and everyone loses when the clock runs out.

20608.name: Stikord
20608.description: Roll four dice with a letter on each. Then describe and word, but only use words starting with the letters you rolled.

boardgamehonor: 2007 Charles S. Roberts Best World War II Boardgame Nominee
20609.description:
from GMT website:

We are proud to announce the companion game to GMT Games' award winning Europe Engulfed. In Asia Engulfed the action takes place across Asia and the Pacific covering the entire war from the attack at Pearl Harbor to the final collapse of the Japanese empire.

Asia Engulfed is a complete stand alone game or it can be combined with Europe Engulfed to simulate the entire Second World War. A complete set of combined game rules allow for unit transfer, production allocation, and combined victory conditions.

Asia Engulfed focuses on playability and making players feel the pressures their historical counterparts were under. Players actually feel the pressures and stresses felt by the strategic level commanders in the real war. The game achieves this level of playability without sacrificing historical detail. The entire campaign is playable in 6-to-9 hours once players become familiar with its elegant game systems.

Wood Block Units:
Wood blocks are used for both land and naval units to provide a realistic fog of war. Different colors are used for not only the different nations but also for land and naval units so there is no confusion as to what is what and who is who. Only the controlling player knows where their elusive carriers are until combat is engaged. Players will have to decide during their naval reaction move if they have the guts to intercept the enemy's unknown forces.

Supply and Oil:
Asia Engulfed incorporates a unique and simple system to realistically portray the Japanese resource limitations. The further your empire expands from Japan the harder it is to supply and operate your far-flung forces, not to mention defend your perimeter with a navy limited by its oil reserves.

China, India, and Australia:
All three are in play and potential targets for Japanese expansion. Could any of them been captured if Japan had focused its resources? While it isn't likely, they are targets that the Allies have to defend and often seem just out of reach. Optional rules can bring the Soviet Union into the game.

Redesigned Air System:
Air assets are critical to a successful campaign in the Pacific, influencing both movement and supply. A carefully designed area map allows air units to exert control into adjacent areas and move across areas to the next airbase without having to worry about tracking range or counting hexes. Carrier air assets are represented by their own counters allowing for their losses to be tracked separately from the carriers and for the Japanese to husband their elite pilots.

Redesigned Naval System:
The naval system is totally redesigned from Europe Engulfed and along with the air system an integral part of Asia Engulfed. Basing limits, extended range movement, naval reaction movement, carrier day or surface ship night combat, surprise effects, port attacks, invasion support, it's all there and when combined with block limited intelligence and a healthy dose of lady luck every engagement brings the thrill of a potential victory and the fear of a devastating defeat. Even submarines get to put in an appearance as they try to pickoff stragglers.

Production and Strategic Warfare:
Asia Engulfed Game Turns represent two months each and production and strategic warfare takes place within each of these turns. Production levels are easy to calculate and production choices include Special Actions, Aircraft Carriers, Battleships, Cruisers, Submarines, Land Based Air and Carrier Based Air units, Infantry, Marines, and an assortment of strategic assets. The USA conducts a strategic submarine campaign against the Japanese naval transport system and later in the war is able to direct strategic bombers over Japan.

Special Actions:
Special Actions are an innovative rule system to allow for not only extended operations during the course of a normal two month game turn but also to represent each sides unique capabilities. From code breaking to emergency rebasing, special actions provide a wealth of options for the player who has been able to commit the necessary resources to build them.

Rulebook and Playbook:
The 24-page rulebook is clearly written with many examples. Also included is a 24-page playbook. The playbook includes player notes, designer notes, combined game rules, optional rules, scenarios, index, and an extended example of play.

Integrates With:

Europe Engulfed
20609.name: Asia Engulfed
boardgamepodcastepisode: Point 2 Point 43: Jason Flies Solo
Point 2 Point Episode 12 - Rick Young and Mark McLaughlin

20610.description: Rapid Fire! is a set of fast play miniatures rules which enables players to re-fight brigade-level combined arms engagements during WW II. Provides for an interesting mix of supporting weapons to go with your infantry, such as artillery, aircraft and armor. Very good rule set to introduce players to World War II miniature gaming.
20610.name: Rapid Fire! (second edition)

20611.name: Wild Kids
20611.description:
Children´s game (Ages 8 and up) with title taken from a Swedish TV show. The show was a bit like "Robinson" ("Survivor" in the U.S.) but more friendly and starring 11- and 12 year-olds. In the game, players move around the board and take part in five competitions. These include solving riddles, answering questions about wild animals, and forming patterns with wooden sticks. The first player to complete three competitions is the winner.

Contents:
Gameboard
4 pawns
1 ordinary die, 1 color die
240 cards with 5 card boxes
1 hourglass
4 wooden sticks
rules

20612.name: PriceWaterhouseCoopers
20612.description:
A promotional game developed by Identity Games for PriceWaterhouseCoopers.

Players try to gather as much 'right answer' tokens and as little 'wrong answer' tokens as possible by answering trivia questions. The winner is the person with the most 'right answer' tokens at the end of the game.

20614.name: Victory at Sea
20614.description:
Victory at Sea is a set of privately published miniatures rules from 1971. The rules simulate ship-to-ship tactical combat from 1898 to about 1970. Compared to more recent rules sets, these rules are almost just an outline. The heart of the rules are several sets of charts for gunnery, torpedoes and movement.
The to-hit system uses a 2D6 roll compared to a chart that gives "chances per 36" for a hit.
There are three scenarios included: Coronel, 1914; River Plate, 1939 and Denmark Straits, 1941. A photocopy sheet has 1:1200 ship plans to cut out for those who don't have miniatures.

20615.name: The Green Pipe
20615.description:
Finalist for 2005 About.com Deduction Game Design Competition.

The first player places the "head" of the pipe on a 4x4 board; the second player, the "tail" of the pipe. Then each player draws a secret pipeline path between the two, crossing at least three spaces. Each player then marks three spaces of her pipe with holes.

By placing and moving injectors of colored liquid, as well as probes, on the board, each player reveals information about both players' pipes. The first player to correctly guess the location of her opponent's three holes wins! (Each time you make a wrong guess, you may not guess again for G turns, where G is the number of wrong guesses you've made so far.)

20617.description:
Battles of the Ancient World, Volume Two, adds more battles to the popular Ancient World series.

Scenarios include:


Issus, November 333 B.C. Issus was the closest Alexander came to defeat, even though he would go on to face a larger Persian army at Arbela two years later.
Metaurus, 207 B.C. During the Second Punic War, Hasdrubal arrived in Italy to reinforce his brother Hannibal. While the two brothers were separated, Roman Counsel Nero sought to defeat Hasdrubal's force by marching his best troops 250 miles north to join the attack against Hasdrubal.
Carrhae, 53 B.C. Roman legions under Crassius were marching to retake Syria when Parthian forces under Surenas surprised them shortly after crossing the Euphrates. The Parthians, who were entirely Cavalry, adopted their tactics of retiring and drawing their foes in pursuit.
Idivisto, A.D. 15 After losing three legions of the Eagles at Teutoberger Wald, the Romans rebuilt their force to recover the Eagles and exact revenge.


Other games in Series:

Four Battles of the Ancient World
Battles of the Ancient World Volume III
Zama: Triumph of the Roman Way of War (Published in Strategy & Tactics magazine #153)
Battles of the Ancient World: Marathon and Granicus (Published in Strategy & Tactics magazine #214)




Also available as a box set with all three volumes.
20617.name: Battles of the Ancient World Volume II
boardgamefamily: Battles of the Ancient World Series

20618.name: The Quest
20618.description:
The exciting game of Biblical knowledge. The game is similar to Trivial Pursuit in which you roll the dice and move your piece around the board acquiring "pieces" of the Armour of God. Once you have answered the Biblical questions correctly and acquired the six pieces of the Armor of God, you can move towards the center of the board to win the game by landing on the Circle of Victory and correctly answering a question.

The questions are divided into 5 categories: "Quotations", "Unbelievers & Believers", "Events", "Saviour", and "Towns, Places & Objects".

Before you can obtain a piece of the Armor of God, you have to obtain 2 Character Points. You get one Character Point for each correctly answered question. Each player must gain two character points before he may attempt to obtain additional pieces of the Armor of God.

20619.name: Bloomsday
20619.description:
A racing game that simulates the 10k Bloomsday race in Spokane, Washington. Players simultaneously choose a number of Endurance Points to "burn". Players burn these points to move along the board, but if you don't burn more than your opponents, you only move one space! Be sure to keep something in the tank for the final stretch.

The board consists of a long track labeled with the different stages in Bloomsday. The board spaces can also make the player go forward or backwards or lose turns. Some spaces give you special cards, like "injury" or "special training" that you can play on yourself or your opponent.

20620.name: Gunjin Shogi
20620.description:
Literally meaning ‘Soldier Shogi’, Gunjin Shogi is not really related to Shogi other than by having a military theme and pentagonal pieces. The game is more similar to Army Chess (Lu Zhan Jun Qi) or Stratego, featuring hidden pieces and a hierarchical system of combat, where higher ranked pieces defeat lower ones: the objective is to capture the opponent’s flag. Like Army Chess, Gunjin Shogi requires a third person to act as umpire and resolve combat. Unlike Army Chess (and more like Hai Lu Kong Jun Qi), Gunjin Shogi includes planes and tanks.

Each player has 23 pieces, consisting of a flag, 12 officers, 2 planes, 2 tanks, a cavalry unit, two engineers, a spy and two land mines. There is a hierarchy of ranks, with some exceptions – planes naturally cannot be destroyed by land mines and engineers deactivate land mines, for instance.

The game dates to at least before the second world war (I base this on an incomplete pre-war set I was shown in an antique shop in Japan).

boardgamecompilation: Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot Deluxe Limited Edition
20621.description:
The Wacky Khaki Booster Deck adds 55 cards to your existing set, a Highest Officer Rank card and 18 colored Chips.

Other fantastic cards include: Army Of The 12 Bunnies which will hunt you down any hour of the day, Locked In which forces players to use their Top and Bottom Run cards and The Lonely Ranger who roams free!

Can you avoid a crippling blow from Mad Bunny Disease, or psych-out your opponents with Truth or Hare! Why not seize the danish with Carpe Scriblita or move a weapon targeting your bunny to an opponent's bunny with the help of the Sky Waitress? Grab one yourself or send a lacky, but don't miss the next Booster Deck named Wacky Khaki!

CONTENTS :: 55 large cards, 18 colored Chips, a Highest Officer Rank card and stand & Instructions.

Expands:

Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot
20621.name: Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot Wacky KHAKI Booster

20622.description: Players travel around the world to visit three places to snap pictures. At the start of the game, three cards with destinations are turned over. On your turn you roll five dice to see which means of transportation may be used that turn (car, airplane, train, boat and rocket). The first to visit a goal gets to take the corresponding card, and a new card is put in place. The first who collects three cards and returns home to Germany wins the game.
20622.name: Mit Felix um die Welt

20623.description:
Alien City is a game that is set in the far future and concerns the building of a city on a newly colonized world. Society in this distant time is divided into four powerful guilds. These are the Energy Guild (symbolized by a red sun), the Synthesis Guild (symbolized by a blue fountain), the Control Guild (the most powerful guild of all, symbolized by a green crown), and the Builder's Guild (symbolized by a black tool---yes, that's how tools look in the far future).

Cities in this future contain two types of structures, towers and domes. Towers are owned by the various guilds. These are the power plants (energy), factories (synthesis), and government facilities (control). Domes are smaller structures used to house the citizens. As with the towers, domes are always associated with a particular guild. Both towers and domes are color-coded to identify guild affiliation; red for energy, blue for synthesis, green for control, and black for builders.

Each of the guilds wants its towers positioned close to the towers and domes of other guilds (their customers) and far away from its own other towers (to avoid competing with other towers of their own guild). Location, location, location! Some things never change, even in the distant future.

The Builder's Guild is unique because there are no Builder's Guild towers, i.e., no black towers. Instead, the Builders are compensated for their efforts by being given the profits of some of the other guilds’ towers that the Builders choose as they construct the city.

The players in this game are competing builders working to construct the city. At the same time, they are choosing towers for themselves that they hope will be profitable with many close customers and little competition. The choices must be made with care because each builder may only choose three.

Red, blue, and green large Icehouse Pieces are used for the towers, and piecepack coins with the suit side up represent red, blue, green, and black domes. The land area of the city is defined by a 4x5 array of piecepack tiles, suit side up, with each tile representing four building sites. The game-play consists of the players alternating turns, placing a tower or dome each turn until either all
available towers and domes have been placed or until there are no legal construction sites remaining within the city. Then scores are determined based upon the relative positions of the towers and domes.

Winner of the piecepack Ludic Synergy design contest.

Online Play


Super Duper Games
20623.name: Alien City

20624.name: Captain Bones Gold
20624.description:
A FamilyFun Magazine 2005 Toy of the Year. They say: "Apparently nobody's ever told old Cap'n Bones that he can't take it with him. As up to four players move gold pieces around his island, the rattling old skeleton pops out of a pirate chest and tries to snatch back his loot."

Company product page sez: "Ahoy, matey! Ya looks like you're ready for adventure, buccaneer style. Grab your cutlass and get ready for swashbucklin' fun in Captain Bones' Gold. Circle the island and collect coins from the pirate treasure, but beware!"

20625.name: Hühnerhof
20625.description:
From the box: Early morning six hungry chickens wait to be fed. There is the farmer's daughter with food. She doesn't put it all in one place, but distributes the food across the farm yard. Now one has to make sure to be quickly at the right spot, to eat the food before it's gone.

Children's game Ages 5 and up.

20626.name: Musashi
20626.description: Musashi is the Japanese take on the tower building dexterity game genre. Unlike Jenga, you don't start out with a tower, but build it yourself, and also unlike Jenga, you don't use your fingers but chopsticks to place the tiles. On each turn, players roll a dice to decide if and how many tiles they have to place on top of the existing stack. To make things a bit more challenging, there are two types of tiles - while they are both round, the standard ones have grooves carved into them that give them some stability. However, there is also a batch of slick tiles which are much harder to put into place.

boardgamehonor: 2005 Charles S. Roberts Best Modern Era Boardgame Nominee
20627.name: Warplan: Dropshot II/III
20627.description:
The Turbulent 60's and The End Game, take Bruce Costello's popular simulation of the Cold War turning hot, Warplan Dropshot from the 50's to the 60's and 70's-90's.

Dropshot II: The Turbulent 60's scenarios: In the "Berlin, 1961" World War III starts at the Berlin Wall. In "The Cuban Missile Crisis, 1962" what almost happened happens. In "The Six Day War," an accident in the Mediterranean sparks the big one in 1967. In The Czechoslovakian Crisis, 1968" Soviet and NATO clashes escalate into total war. "Border War in the Far East, 1969" has the US getting involved in a nuclear war between China and Russia.

Dropshot III: The End Game scenarios: In "Middle East, 1973" the US and the Soviet Union get too involved with the Yom Kippur War. In "1976 - Bolt from the Blue" Kremlin hardliners opt for a preemptive war while everyone is taking détente. "December Surprise - Iran, 1979" has President Carter invading Iran and the Soviets having to react. In "Solidarity - Poland, 1981" the labor movement is crushed and the West reacts. In "Deep Paranoia" a NATO exercise pushes the Soviets too far. "Hardliners Last Gasp, 1987" supposes an alternative end to the Cold War.

400 km/hex on strategic map and 75 km/hex on map of Europe, 2 months/turn, armies.

This is a DTP game with die-cut counters. Two 8.5x11 inch strategic hemispheric maps, one 11x17 inch map of Europe, 616 counters, play aids, charts.

Warplan: Dropshot II/III was a nominee in the Charles S. Roberts awards for Best Modern Era Boardgame (Charles S. Roberts Awards) for 2005.

20628.name: I Am NOT a Communist
20628.description:
The year is 1955, and communism is spreading in the US Senate! One by one, it is silently overtaking a majority of the voting Senators--that is, unless the stalwart Special Investigator can help the remaining red-blooded, freedom-loving, true-blue American faction as they hold hearings in an attempt to oust the evil Original Communist in the nick of time.

For the growing communist faction and their stealthy Original Communist leader, the goal is to convert a majority of the voting members of the Senate to communism. For the freedom-loving members of the Senate, the goal is to successfully identify the Original Communist and remove his voting rights before his evil creed takes over.

20630.description: Timeline 400 B.C.,Greece. The foundation has been laid for a new temple. Two "architects" attempt to form a line of 3 constructions which are topped by the same type of playing piece. Using the Corinthian Column capitals, columns and bases as the playing pieces, an architect may add a new piece to the game, stack a piece on top of another, or move a piece. Competitive strategy skills will cast the winner’s name in stone!
20630.name: Corintho

20632.name: Miezen-Memo
20632.description: Miezen-Memo is a memory game. Here you must find the matching pictures of cute cats.

20634.description:
From the rulebook:

MiniMonFa is a 2-player, non-collectible card game that allows you to become an Archmage who must set up his dungeon in order to defend himself from the ongoing attacks of the local heroes, always covetous of glory, treasures, and experience points.

You have to build your dungeon with great mastery and shrewd strategy to stop the heroes: to achieve such a result, you can place insidious traps and unleash powerful and cunning creatures.

Besides defending your underground dwelling, you will have to lead the fearless heroes you recruited to get rid of the competing Archmage who is weakening your grip on the surrounding areas.

Defend your own dungeon and assail your enemy's! Will you find the way to manage both? Are you ready to try?

Expanded by:

MiniMonFa Fairy Expansion
MiniMonFa Espansione Mondo Sotterraneo
MiniMonFa Undead Expansion
MiniMonFa Espansione Rigor Mortis
MiniMonfa: 2 promo cards
MiniMonFa: Baby Cthulhu Promo
MiniMonFa: Black Dragon Promo
MiniMonFa: Jon Snow Promo
MiniMonFa: Stormbringer Promo
20634.name: MiniMonFa (MiniMonsterFantasy)

20635.description:
This is the first expansion for MiniMonFa (MiniMonsterFantasy)
Now its is possible to fill your dungeons with new incredible creatures like dryads, gnomes and ents. You also get 6 new heroes like an Warrior Elf and an Centaur.

With this expansion it is also possible to play the game with more than 2 players.

Expands:

MiniMonFa (MiniMonsterFantasy)




Other Expansions:

MiniMonFa Undead Expansion
MiniMonFa Espansione Mondo Sotterraneo
MiniMonFa Espansione Rigor Mortis
20635.name: MiniMonFa Fairy Expansion

20636.description:
The second expansion for MiniMonFa (MiniMonsterFantasy) brings a crowd of terrible monsters like zombies and a vampire. You also get a new set of heroes with unique special abilities.

Expands:

MiniMonFa (MiniMonsterFantasy)




Other Expansions:

MiniMonFa Fairy Expansion
MiniMonFa Espansione Mondo Sotterraneo
MiniMonFa Espansione Rigor Mortis
20636.name: MiniMonFa Undead Expansion

20637.description:
From the Publisher's website:

The treacherous fascist invasion has awakened a slumbering giant. It has triggered the massive mobilization of brave soldiers and diligent factory workers. Together these comrades have built the mightiest army the world has ever seen – the awesome RKKA, the Red Army.

The foolhardy Germans will now feel the wrath of the Soviet people, and be crushed by it. All that will be left of the Hitlerites will be their gleaming bones turned over by our plows in the summer planting.

Inside You Will Find

• Complete organization and equipment for the Tankovy Batalon (Tank Battalion), Mixed Tankovy Batalon (Mixed Tank Battalion), Motostrelkovy Batalon (Motor Rifle Battalion), Rota Razvedki (Reconnaissance Company) and Kazachya Sotnya (Cossack Squadron).

• Variants for the Gvardeyskiy Tankovy Batalon (Guards Tank Battalion), Gvardeyskiy Motostrelkovy Batalon(Guards Motor Rifle Battalion), Gvardeyskiy Rota Razvedki (Guards Reconnaissance Company) and the Gvardeyskiy Kazachya Sotnya (Guards Cossack Squadron).

• History of the 3rd Mechanized Corps.

• Inspiring colour photos

• Fantastic Artwork by Vincent Wai

• Tactics guide

• Comprehensive painting guides

• Exploits of Mariya Oktyabrskaya, winner of the Hero of the Soviet Union, the highest award for heroism.
20637.name: Za Stalina: Handbook on Soviet Armoured and Cavalry forces

20639.name: Preussen Memo
20639.description:
From the publisher's website:

Prussia Memo: A memory game which gives you a closer look at culture, symbols and the history of Prussia.

20642.name: CubiCup
20642.description: Each player chooses a set of colored cubes. The players take turns placing cubes on the board. The player who places the last cube at the top of the pyramid is the winner.

20643.name: Friesen-Törn
20643.description: Friesen-Torn is a wild kind of regatta, where 3-6 players are chasing each other with their small sail boats. In the best pirate's tradition, the opponents' boats are rammed in order to get winning points. Friesen-Torn is like bumper cars in the sea. Players steer their boats by special sailing cards.

20644.name: Contraption
20644.description:
Contraption is a unique, motorized game from Lakeside. The game itself consists of 2 sets of colored marbles and a single unit with 4 gears on its surface. The gears are laid end-to-end, with the larger gears in the middle. Each player claims one of the smaller end gears as their "home" gear.

To play, the unit (requiring 2 "D" batteries) is turned on, which sets all 4 gears spinning. Then the marbles are dumped into the large central gears. Each player controls a switch that, when pressed, lowers a gate between their home gear and the larger gear, allowing marbles to pass through -- but also letting marbles pass back out to the larger gears.

The goal of the game is to be the first player to capture all 6 of your marbles in your home gear.

20645.name: Tenakee
20645.description:
Here's a description of the game from Spielbox:

This new publisher is presenting its first game: Tenakee. Under the title ‘Coco-Nut’, Michael Feldkotter had submitted this game as part of the SAZ competition for game authors at last year’s Essen fair. Alan R. Moon had run the competition and fronted the prize money; 9 authors with a total of 16 prototypes entered. This game won first prize.

The great totem pole competition is being held among the Tenakee Indians. Those taking part want to show off the most beautiful and valuable totem poles. But the poles are only scored when it gets a point, so that the Indians like to annoy each other by climbing up and putting points on poles. At the same time, the squaws are using the event to search for a man. Which carver is brave enough to climb the high totem poles?

20646.description:
1824 Austria-Hungary is a railway building and share dealing game for 3-6 players. It is based on Francis Tresham's game 1829 and on Leonhard Orgler's game 1837.

Historical realities have, as far as possible, been taken into account. In other places the history should and must be written anew.
The player who has the greatest wealth in cash and shares at the end of the game is the winner. A set of simple mechanisms form the basis of 1824 Austria-Hungary.

You use the yellow, green, brown and grey tiles to create a rail network on the map. Just as in a real railway business, the track in the game connects railway stations to each other. The trains (train cards) make notional journeys from one station to the next and thereby earn money. The (imaginary) passengers pay for their journeys. The more numerous and the more important the stations on a train's journey are, the more money it earns for the company and its shareholders.

In the game you and your fellow players can own up to 6 Mountain Railways, 4 Coal Railways, 7 forerunners of the National Railways, as well as shares in 3 National Railways and 5 Regional Railways. The Major Companies (the National and Regional Railways) belong to their shareholders. The player with the most shares in the company is the Director of that company and decides how the company will act.

20647.name: Fart!
20647.description:
Manufacturer's Description
Fart
Flatulent fun with your CD player!

Fart is the sound-sational game of rip-roaring fun that will challenge even straight-laced Aunt Grace to keep a straight face!

An instant source of laughter, Fart is the hilarious game in which you race to be the first to play out of cards whilst accompanied by a fast 'n' frantic Fart-chorus!

Every now and then an unrealistically enormous explosion will let rip forcing you to change direction, pick up penalty cards or 'Pass the Wind' to your neighbor!

Wild hilarity at the press of a button, Fart is the side-splitting game that helps you to unwind and release a little pressure!

Box Contents

99 Track Fart Effect CD
Score Pad + Rule Book
Fart Game Cards

20648.name: Century 1900-2000
20648.description: Here's a great game that focuses on American 20th Century social, political, and historical information in a "trivia" game format. Players answer questions covering important events of the century while moving across the gameboard and collecting playing tokens. It's a great game for school and home! 2-4 Players Ages 9 and up

20649.name: States & Capitals Zip Around
20649.description: Each player receives a double sided card which is keyed so that a question on one card requires an answer on the card of another player. This high-interest activity allows players to become familiar with the capitals and numerous geographic characteristics of all 50 states. Grades 6-12

20650.name: California Chase
20650.description: Players begin their game in San Diego and chase their way up the state of California while drilling language arts basic skills. This exciting game integrates geography and language arts skills in a fun format designed for 4th through 7th grade students. Skill areas include spelling, antonyms, synonyms, word usage, capitalization, and punctuation. 2-4 players Grades 4-7

20651.name: States & Capitals Match Wits
20651.description: Players use these 50, four-sided domino game to match the capitals, time zones, and geographic regions of the 50 United States. Each of the four different categories have different point values. Strategic placement achieves high scores! 1-4 players. Grades 4-8

20652.name: States And Capitals Challenge
20652.description: Here's a way to master U.S. Geography and have fun too! Players move around a track of flags surrounding a colorful map of the United States. They capture states by correctly identifying state capitals. Ownership of the state can be challenged by answering trivia questions relating to facts, landmarks, and state nicknames. 2-4 players Grades 4-12

20653.description:
A Battle study for Advanced Squad Leader covering Operation Bagration.
From the publisher's website:
The Minsk-Moscow Highway, Belorussia, 23 June 1944:
The 16th Guards Rifle Division was one of three heavily reinforced infantry divisions that were to create holes in the German lines and allow tank forces of the 2nd Guards Tank Corps of the 5th Tank Army to make rapid and deep penetrations along the Moscow-Minsk Highway. The zone of the 16th was south of the highway, and along the Smolensk-Minsk Railroad. They were reinforced with the following units: 148th Tank Regiment (PT mineroller tanks), 63rd Guards Heavy Tank Regiment (KVs), 517th Tank Regiment (FT tanks), elements of several Self-Propelled Artillery Regiments, 2nd Guards Assault Engineer-Sapper Brigade, as well as numerous towed artillery units. The Soviet forces trained as a combined arms team prior to the attack, and were well prepared. In most sectors of Army Group Center, the Germans had relatively thin lines, and most armor and heavy artillery was stripped to defend expected areas of attack. The area of the highway had seen much heavy fighting in the winter of 1943-44, and the Germans expected an attack to come in this direction. When German intelligence detected the buildup of artillery and armored forces, as well as the movement of ammunition, their reaction was to ensure forces in this area retained significant combat strength. The 78th Sturm Division, already the most powerful ‘infantry‘ division in Army Group Center, maintained its structure which included the 189th Assault Gun Battalion (StuG), a Heavy Tank Destroyer Battalion (PzJgIII/IVs), 5th Nebelwerfer Battalion (120mm Mortars), and Army Antiaircraft Battalion 293 (mix of 88s/20s). These forces defended from probably the most dense network of mines, trenches, and bunkers in Army Group Center, including special rotating bunkers housing machine-guns.
Years of extensive on-sight research along with vigorous play testing by the veteran game designers at Heat of Battle brings you ONSLAUGHT TO ORSHA.
ONSLAUGHT TO ORSHA contains:

* Color 29x56" historical map featuring 1" hexes of the Smolensk-Minsk Railroad area
* Chapter OtO, that includes rules for new units, terrain types and vehicle notes
* Campaign Game, 22 scenarios and 2 Solitaire Missions
* 17 Page Map Study and Order of Battle
* And, over 180 new, full color counters covering vehicles and weapons not seen in an tactical wargame system are included for free!
20653.name: Onslaught to Orsha

20654.name: Add & Subtract Chekker Math
20654.description: Play checkers and enjoy improving addition and subtraction skills. This fun and fast paced game may be played by two individuals or two teams with similar or different learning ability. Grades 2-6

20655.name: Slugger
20655.description: This baseball simulation game incorporates math skills as players learn the ins and outs of baseball. Records are kept by players as they compute hits, outs, batting averages, and percentages.

20656.name: Jungle Bungle Game
20656.description: Jungle Bungle is a truly new kind of game that's out and out fun. With its talking dice, lucky dip bag and exciting game play it is a must for kids of all ages. Players are out to get a full set of snaps of the wild jungle animals prowling the board. Each turn the dice, growls, trumpets, roars, laughs or tells you what to do.

20657.name: English Volley
20657.description: Students reinforce their knowledge of prepositions in this vollyball simulation game. Players take turns and "serve" questions from one of the four sets of story cards and "return" the answers. This activity covers prepositional phrases; prepositional after verbs; and prepositional after nouns, adjectives, and participles. Each set of cards, when assembled numerically from 1-48, tells a story, original or adapted from multicultural folk tales. For 2-10+ players ESL Adult and Grades 5-12

20658.name: Pursuit
20658.description: Players learn how to build words using prefixes and base words. The base words are located within the game board squares, and the prefixes are listed on the spinner. Students spin and move to the first space where that prefix can be used with a base word to form a word. 245 words can be formed. 2-4 players. Grades 4-8

20659.name: Doh Nutters
20659.description:
Dohnutters a crazy, noisy, nutty game of elephantine fun!

Play the part of a crazy doughnut-loving elephant in this hilarious game of fast action fun.

Can you be the first elephant to get all your doughnuts on your trunk?

The first one is easy, the next harder and with the final doughnut tension reaches an all time high!

Box Contents
- 4 Elephant masks (with adjustable straps)
- 12 plastic "doughnuts"
- 1 playing board.

20660.description:
Publisher's Description

Munchkin 4: The Need for Steed is the latest expansion for the original Munchkin - 112 more John Kovalic-illustrated cards for killing monsters, stealing treasure, and backstabbing your fellow players. This set introduces Steeds, the trusty mounts of legend... Oh, wait - this is Munchkin! So these Steeds include not just the Dragon and the Tiger, but the Giant Mutant Gerbil (drawn by guest artist Shaenon K. Garrity of Narbonic), the Chicken, and Big Joe, who might be a Steed or might be a Hireling. It's hard to tell.

Hireling? Yes indeed, The Need for Steed has lots and lots of Hirelings, who look quite a bit like Sidekicks from Super Munchkin, or Minions from Munchkin Bites! Add these valuable characters to your retinue, use their special abilities, and sacrifice them without a thought to save your own skin! Or, better yet, kill somebody else's Hireling. That's the way a Munchkin does it!

Feel the need... The Need for Steed


Other

Part of the Munchkin series.
boardgameversion: English May 2010 color and rules/card change edition
20660.name: Munchkin 4: The Need for Steed
boardgamepodcastepisode: BGA Ep. 94 - Suburbia vs. The Castles of Mad King Ludwig

20661.name: Decimal Olympics
20661.description: Competition in popular Olympic activities is incorporated in this exciting game using decimals from 10ths to 1000ths. Over 40 problems using addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division of decimals are included. Olympic activities including the javelin, discus, shot-put, and pole vault allow students to earn points toward winning a gold, silver, or bronze medal. For 2-4 players plus a referee.

20662.name: Fraction Olympics
20662.description: Over 400 problems for each of the four basic math operations are included in this exciting fractions game. Competition in ten popular Olympics events are used to motivate players. For example, the javelin, discus, shot-put, pole vault, and many more activities allow students to earn points towards winning a gold, silver, or bronze medal. For 2-4 players and a referee.

20663.name: Factor Football
20663.description: Two players or teams can score touchdowns, field goals, and experience other activities found in football games as they practice multiplication skills. For example: 6X2 = 12 which represents a fumble with no points scored.

20664.name: Party Time
20664.description: Players will begin to understand the problem solving details that go into having a party as they play this game. Included are activities that use addition and subtraction of time, money, and liquid measurement. For example: 4 cups of punch equal one quart. How many cups of punch equal one gallon? The time is 1:00p.m. and the party starts in 15 minutes. What time does the party start? 2-4 players Grades 2-6

20665.name: Bear Hunt
20665.description: Students become masterminds as they use inductive and deductive reasoning with this exciting game. Using colorful bears, students build color pattern riddles that their opponent must solve on the transparent gameboard. This activity is great for whole class competition or for use in learning centers. 2- players or whole class participation. Grades 1-6

20666.name: Baseball Card Grand Slam
20666.description: Here's an action packed board game designed to meet a variety of educational needs while tapping into America's favorite pastime... Baseball! As players build their own teams, they use their own baseball cards or the baseball cards included in the game to answer problem solving questions. Included are integrated reading, math, and geography skills covering time zones, states and capitals, major league cities, rivers, lakes, and oceans. Lots of baseball trivia is included. There are five levels of difficulty, allowing players of different ability levels to play together. 2-4 players or teams. Grades 2-12

20667.name: Equation Golf
20667.description: Play golf while you learn to compute combinations of addition, subtraction, multiplication, division, cubes, square roots, and more. Using 60 cards in the deck along with golf terminology, players draw "stroke" cards to create equations which solve a target number. After nine rounds of play the game is over and the player with the lowest score wins the game.

20669.description:
Renegade Legion: Leviathan Scenario Book - 64 pages with 15 new scenarios.

This book includes a background story of the INS Kraken and it's new commander, Rear Admiral Luther Catalus. Catalus has run afoul of Imperial politics and has been sent on a suicide mission. The book covers the campaign fought by the INS Kraken and it's escort squadron in 15 interlinked scenarios. The campaign is designed to be played through with the same units and track damage between scenarios. Rules are included to cover resupply and repair. Complete profiles of the key members of the Kraken Squadron are also included.

The book also provides the designs of several ships, many of which are also included the Renegade Legion: Leviathan Capital Ship Briefing. Other ships are new to this book. These ships are:
Leicester Class Freighter
Republic Class Battleship
Gav'Rosk Class Cruiser
Raptor Class Destroyer Carrier
VLCA design
GavRon Listening Post

Special scenario rules also include a battle within an asteroid field that has hidden units and objectives.

Expands:

Renegade Legion: Leviathan
20669.name: Renegade Legion: Leviathan – The Wake of the Kraken

20670.description:
Renegade Legion: Centurion Scenario Book - 48 pages with 12 new scenarios, as well as new units, characters and equipment.

Expands:

Renegade Legion: Centurion – Blood & Steel
20670.name: Renegade Legion: 2nd ACR Armored Cavalry Regiment

20671.name: Clock Dominoes
20671.description: 45 durable dominoes are included in this challenging game. It may be played at three levels of difficulty, covering hours, half hours, and quarter hours using clock faces, digital time, and written time. 1-4 players. Grades 2-6

20672.description:
Renegade Legion: Centurion Vehicle Briefing Book - 128 pages describing 58 different vehicles and variants.

Expands:

Renegade Legion: Centurion – Blood & Steel
20672.name: Renegade Legion: Centurion Blood & Steel Vehicle Briefing

20673.name: Bahcheck
20673.description: The object of the game is to advance all of your stakes to the finish line before your opponent in order to win. The game can be played opposite each other or side-by-side. When playing opposite each other, the game cards must be placed in the card bay so that the green block is at the bottom and at the player’s right. Playing side-by-side, both cards must be placed with the green block at the bottom. Stakes must be advanced vertically only. There are three (3) versions to this game: RANDOM, MIX, and FIX. Random is the basic version and should be learned first....

20674.name: Chase Whole Numbers
20674.description: Here's a great, competitive, fun-filled game. Each player chooses a colored pawn and follows the track around the board by spinning and moving to a specific number in either the ones, tens, hundreds and thousands place. The winner is decided by the first player who makes it once around the board and follows their colored alley to the center of the board. Grades 1-4

20675.description:
From the Steve Jackson Games website:

Marriage. Royalty. Tragedy. Will your line reign supreme? King's Blood is a fast-paced multi-player card game. Build the family tree by arranging marriages, exiling rivals, and crowning new royalty. Match a character with a compatible member of the opposite sex, and start a new generation. Play the last family member from your hand, and you've won!

King's Blood was originally published by Kadokawa Shoten in Japan, where it remains a fan favorite. Steve Jackson Games is proud to offer the authorized English translation of this fast, fun game, complete with all the beautiful original manga artwork.

90 cards in a tuck box.
20675.name: King's Blood

20676.name: Chase Large Numbers
20676.description: Here's a great, competitive, fun-filled game. Each player chooses a colored pawn and follows the track around the board by spinning and moving to a specific number in the thousand, millions, up to the hundred millions place. The winner is decided by the first player who makes it once around the board and follows their colored alley to the center of the board.

20677.name: Chase Decimals
20677.description: Here's a great, competitive, fun-filled game. Each player chooses a colored pawn and follows the track around the board by spinning and moving to a specific number in either the tenths, hundredths, and thousandths place. The winner is decided by the first player who makes it once around the board and follows their colored alley to the center of the board. Grades 4-7

20678.description:
This started life as a computer game by Ingo Althöfer and has been worked into a board game by Reinhold Wittig. The board is in the shape of Easter Island (Rapa Nui) and has 45 spaces. Each player has 2 pieces which are placed on the board. On a turn a piece is moved to an adjacent empty space and a wooden die-holder is then put in the place just moved from. A die is then rolled and put in the holder. After the first 9 moves, each turn also has a second element. This is to remove an empty holder from the board or to roll a die and remove a die from the board with the same number (thus leaving an empty holder). The aim is to be the last player to be able to move.
You need to be able to corner off an area for yourself and also to be in positions where removal of dice will benefit your future movement.
20678.name: Rapa Nui

20679.name: Einparken bis zum Abwinken
20679.description:
This uses a similar idea to the popular 'parking' puzzles but in a strategy game. Each player has 5 vehicles - 3 normal cars (2x1 spaces), a bus (3x1 spaces) and a Smart car (1x1). On your turn you have 3 choices: 1) Place a vehicle face down, 2) Turn one of your vehicles face up and choose its direction of travel without altering its position (so the larger vehicles can choose two directions, the Smart can choose four), 3) Move one of your vehicles one space in its direction of travel.
The aim is to be the last player to be able to move. Even if one cannot move at some stage of the game if your way is subsequently cleared you can still move then.

20680.description: This is a collection of 12 games playable with the same components released to commemorate the 150th anniversary of Gauss' death. The games are mainly 2 player. They use a set of wooden blocks which come in lengths of 1 to 6. A die is used in many of them to determine the length of the piece to be placed. There are variants on connecting-sides-of-the-board, placement-within-a-limited-space, moving- across-the-board, blocking and capturing games. 8 are adult games, 4 children's games. There are also an additional 2 adult games by Peter Lewe.
20680.name: Play Gauss

20681.name: Discount
20681.description: Over 400 real-life challenges are included in this great game. Players learn to purchase furniture, clothing, appliances and more. Extensive drill in computing percentages, fractional discounts, keeping financial records and reconciling accounts is covered. Great for home use, and learning centers. 2-4 Players Grades 5-12

20683.name: Die Wackelpudding-Jagd
20683.description:
In the center of the board, there are wobble puddings in a clearing. Players roll a die and move their 'little monster' to collect them and bring them back to their home. But the puddings are guarded by a dragon, which may be moved when the players roll its symbol. Players can be send home like in pachisi, with the capturing player also capturing the pudding.

The game ends when all 10 puddings are distributed. They have 1-3 points on the bottom side, and the player with the highest total wins.

20684.name: Gamegame
20684.description:
A description from Greg Costikyan:

Aki Jarvinen has posted cards and rules for GameGame 1.0… which he pitches as an attempt to do for games what Understanding Comics does for comics: that is, to provide insight into the nature of games in a game, in the same what that Understanding is both “about comics” and a comic.

Thus, his cards are things like “Goal” and “Environment” and “Victory/End Condition.” There’s both a coherent set of rules for determining victory and a roleplaying element: players must improvise what the game they are creating is like, e.g., describing what their “Victory/End Condition” is–but they can only have one if they have the relevant card.

Version 2.0 recently became available at the website below.

Website: http://gamegame.blogs.com/

20685.description: In Henne Berta (Hen Berta in English) the player feeds a hen with grain and in return gathers eggs to a little basket. The first player that gets 3 eggs to basket is the winner. The game contains a wooden board, large wooden pieces and little baskets for every player.
20685.name: Henne Berta

20686.name: RPM
20686.description: RPM is a race simulation released by Grow during the 80's in Brazil.

20687.name: Math Around The School
20687.description: How long did John Glenn orbit the earth? This and many more curious questions are included in this fun-filled game. History, math, problem solving, and trivia are incorporated into three levels of difficulty so that students at different ability levels can be challenged as they play together. 2-4 Players Grade 3-8

20688.name: Place Search Small Numbers
20688.description: Place Search is a great activity in a four-sided domino format. Players match words with their corresponding numerals. Two levels of difficulty cover numbers through the thousands place. 1-4 players. Grades 3-12

20689.name: Place Search Large Numbers
20689.description: Place Search is a great activity in a four-sided domino format. Players match words with their corresponding numerals. Two levels of difficulty cover numbers through the hundred millions place. 1-4 players. Grades 3-12

20690.name: Tic Tac Frac
20690.description: Using the tic-tac-toe format and three levels of difficulty, students are immersed in competitive drill with equivalent fractions.

20691.name: Equivalent Fraction Dominoes
20691.description: This game contains 45 dominoes and five game ideas using halves, thirds, fourths, fifths, sixths, and eighths. It's great for home use or learning centers.

20692.name: Operação MX-1
20692.description:
Most likely the first "real" wargame (by today's standards) released in Brazil, it had lukewarm reception during the 80's and has been discontinued.
The game simulates a battle between two fictitious armies, using an hexagonal board and two sets of rules: basic and advanced.
This is the same Avalon Hill's Tactics II (1958), with a redesigned hexgrid mapboard.

20693.description:
"Jon Compton's tactical hex and counter game of WWII combat. This set focuses on Germany versus Poland at the start of the war."

Each hex on the map represents an area approximately 100 yards across. Each playing piece represents about 40-60 men (a platoon) or half a dozen vehicles or towed weapons . . . For ease of play, the game scales are approximated. Time is also abstracted, thus turns represent several minutes.

The FOXHOLE system is simple to learn and fast playing that focuses on the invasion of Poland. Its a good diversion from the more heavy fair of historical board-wargaming.

FOXHOLE SET 2 includes:
-Ten new scenarios, six exclusively with this set, and four incorporating elements from Set 1.
-Twenty-four unit cards
-Over one hundred playing pieces -Tactical Battles Map A - and One rule book
20693.name: Foxhole 2: Poland

20694.name: Sillage
20694.description:
Approx. translation of the box.
Card game in the universe of "Sillage". The comic of Philippe Buchet and Jean David Morvan.

The Sillage convoy explores space trying to find worlds to colonize while looking for aliens species that are in danger of extinction. In this game you create a Sillage Ops and, with action cards, you try to install aliens on different planets.
Be careful, the competition is rough : the other players can play "poukram" (NB : favorite swear of the heroin) to make your task more difficult.

20695.name: Number One
20695.description: This game is played on a hex board, you have 3 Figures, the first (King) can move only 1 step (if you lose that piece you are out of the game), the second piece can move 2 step and the third can move 3 step. When you move on a hex a stone fall, so the hex is no more usable. When you must move one figure on an empty hex, the first time you can turn over the figure, the second time the figure goes out of the game. If is the King all your figures go out. The last player on the board is the winner.

20696.name: Batter Up! Math
20696.description: Incorporate baseball with addition, subtraction, multiplication and division problems. With three levels of difficulty, students from first to sixth grade can have fun in pairs or small groups as the play baseball. Get the whole class involved by creating an overhead transparency from the black line master that is included. This game may also be adapted for weekly homework assignments and remedial math programs. 2-4 players or 2 teams.

20697.description:
It's the first game of a trilogy of two-player Napoleonic campaign games.
Napoleon's Italian campaigns take place during the time of Napoleon's campaigns from 1796 through 1800 in Italy.
The game contains the maps, 252 counters, charts and tables
20697.name: Napoleon's Italian Campaigns

20698.name: Romans
20698.description: Players journey around the Roman Empire, conquering garrison forts in a race to proclaimed "Caesar"! The fascinating history of the Roman Empire will be explored whilst playing the game!

20699.description: Picdoku is a brand new pictorial version of the Sudoku craze that has gripped us all! It can be played individually or competitively by 2 players or teams. Each game includes 182 sturdy re-usable tokens and 30 double-sided playing boards so that 60 different games can be played again and again.
20699.name: Picdoku

20700.name: Fraction Dominoes
20700.description: Using 45 dominoes, players may play at 1of 3 levels of difficulty while adding fractions to find the sum of 1. Fractional parts are shown in pictorial and numerical form. It's a great activity for home and in learning centers.

20701.description: Santiago 1898: Final del Imperio is a simulation of the campaign of Santiago de Cuba during the Spanish - American War.
20701.name: Santiago 1898: Final del Imperio

20702.name: Play Ball Multiplication
20702.description: Introduce children to the great American pastime...BASEBALL while they practice multiplication problems with factors of 3,4,6,7,8, and 9. Multiplication problems determine base hits, singles, triples, home runs, and more. Example: 3X7 = 21 which denotes a single. 4X9 = 36 or a "triple". 2 players or teams may play. Grades 4-8

20703.name: Trasimeno 217 a.c.
20703.description: Battle of Lake Trasimene (217 BC) during the Second Punic war.

20704.name: 1860: I mille
20704.description: "Expedition of the Thousand": Garibaldi's campaign against the Kingdom of Two Sicilies.

20705.name: Adua 1896
20705.description: Battle of Adowa : Italy against the Abyssina.

20707.name: Equivalent Fractions Match Wits
20707.description: Two sets of 30 quadromino tiles provide drill in equivalent fraction recognition at two levels of difficulty. Level 1 includes fractions from 1/4 to 10/12; Level 2 covers 1/4 to 21/24. Each tile shows fractions in numerical form. It's a great activity for individuals, play at home, or in learning centers.

20708.description:
Uses the same game system as Invasion of Italy, Red Parachutes and Red Steel. As far as we know, this is the first detailed treatment of the battles that, at last, stopped Erwin Rommel’s attempts to take the British position in the Nile delta. They also established Bernard Montgomery as the British general finally able to defeat the "Desert Fox."

Following the fall of Tobruk in May 1942, the Commonwealth forces in the desert struggled to reach the last real defensive position before Alexandria and halt what seemed to be an unstoppable Afrika Korps. At battalion and company level, four turns a day and 2 kilometers per hex, this game includes German, Italian, Indian, British, South African, New Zealand, Australian, Free French and Greek units that fought in the desperate struggle.

Scenarios include the Australian and South African spoiling attack in mid-July, the late June battle for the Mersa Matruh position where slow response almost cost the Commonwealth the bulk of the New Zealand Division, the first Axis attack on the Alamein line in early July, the last Axis attack to break the Allied line at Alam el Halfa at the end of August, Operation LIGHTFOOT: the Eighth Army’s attack against the Axis line in late October and the massive campaign from the end of June to the beginning of November 1942.

Four full-sized maps and 2,100 game pieces.
20708.name: Alamein

20710.description:
Using the same game system as MacArthur's Return, Blood on the Snow and Winter Fury, this game covers the fighting in southern Malaya as the advancing Japanese drive the British, Indian and Australian forces back on their base at Singapore. What is different about this game is that it allows the British player to request the 7th Australian Infantry Division and 7th Armored Brigade, historically at sea during the battle and considered as a possible remedy. These two powerful formations might just turn the tide and defeat the Japanese.

Can the British player hold on long and well enough to convince General Wavell that the situation can be restored? Can the Japanese player out-manuever and outfight the British forces defending Johore province and gain a toehold on the island before resistance stiffens or reinforcements arrive?

One full-sized map, 420 game pieces.
20710.name: Tiger of Malaya

20712.name: So You Think You Know Maine
20712.description:
From the box:
"A game of Maine trivia suitable for natives and people from away."

Players start in Kittery (Southern Maine). Counties in Maine represent different categories. As players roll and move around the board, they must collect cards at each county seat. Players then race to Fort Kent (Northern Maine) to win the game.

20713.name: Overlord
20713.description:
Overlord is a "2 player game of pure 3D strategy"
The game is played on a 7x9 board with a wall located on the middle row on the longer side.Both players have 14 pieces located in the back 2 rows on each side of the wall and attempt to capture the opponents pieces by landing on top of them. Only pieces on the top of stacks can move and the game is won when one player is down to only one available piece.

20714.name: Synonym Line Up
20714.description: Three levels of difficulty are included in this fast-paced tic-tac-toe styled game. Three game cards are included and players match antonyms from their playing card, to base words found on the spinner. The first person to form a line of antonyms on the board wins the game.

20715.name: V-Attack
20715.description: The year is 2340. Just as in all of history, conquest is at the heart of mankind. Enslave or become a slave is the future. You are in charge of breaking through the wall of your enemy’s city to allow the entry of your battalion to take over. Organic Titazium metal (O37T2y) has been used in the construction of all walls during this time period, which makes them virtually impenetrable. The wall cubes must be removed carefully or the wall structure will collapse and repair itself thus defeating your mission. While you are attacking the walls of your enemy, they in turn are attacking you. By using limited means, you must minimize the damage directed to your city. Victory belongs to he who enters the city first.

20716.name: The Complete Book of Games
20716.description:
This is a very large book (900 pages) explaining rules to all kinds of games. The first 300 pages are dedicated solely to card games. The book then moves on to traditional board and dice games such as checkers, backgammon, and craps. There are many word and guessing games. Outdoor activities are also listed, including races, snow or water games, lawn games, and full-blown sports.

Ideas for adults' get-togethers include quick-thinking contests and even dancing games. The book details countless games for children, suitable for everyday play or social events such as birthday parties. Some of the party games are geared toward specific holidays.

This huge volume devotes one little paragraph to branded games such as Monopoly, Pit, and Flinch. It only mentions that they exist, and require special equipment, which is purchased along with the rules.

Although you'll find very familiar entries such as bridge, marbles, and baseball, many of the games are less known, or a variation on a more familiar idea. Some of the names are intriguing in their own right. Here's a sampling of names of the many games to learn:

Misery Nap
Bierspiel
Anti-nudist
Hearts of Lettuce
Skeegee-Weegee
The G Man Never Takes His Ease
Literary Salad
Strawberries Without Cream
Schnozzle Race

20717.name: Hey, Bartender!
20717.description:
In Hey, Bartender! everyone is trying to take change from a friendly bartender. Each player is dealt a hand of seven cards. The 'bartender' also gets seven cards, played face up on the table. The object of the game is to trade cards with the bartender, making change such that the bartender gives the player more points than the player gives the bartender. Play continues until all players have exhausted their hands, at which time the player with the most points wins.

Hey, Bartender! was designed as another version of Pennywise played with cards, and was published in Game Trade Monthly in 2000.

20718.name: Escape
20718.description: Players learn how to build words using suffixes and base words. The base words are located within the gameboard squares, and the suffixes are listed on the spinner. Students spin and move to the first space where that suffix can be used with a base word to form a word. 245 words can be formed.

20719.name: Wolf im Schafspelz
20719.description: Wolf im Schafspelz (Wolf in Sheep's Clothing) is a deduction game, wherein players take turns trying to pick the wolf out from a flock of sheep using sheepdogs. For those desiring a more complex game, trees are included to break up the sheepdogs' lines of sight.

20720.description:
From the back cover:

"The alternative games in this booklet are all designed to be played with standard equipment. They offer exciting new dimensions to games played on or with draught boards, cards, dominoes etc., helping to eliminate the constant financial burden of purchasing expensive and often short-lived new games.

The games in Alternative Games for Those Who Like a Challenge are based on popular games that have been modified so they are even more competitive and exciting.
At the same time, they are easy to learn if you already know the standard edition, providing hours of inexpensive entertainment, making this booklet desirable for most game lovers.

Other books designed by Tony Crow are:
Alternative Games for the Family and
Alternative Games for the Studious"

This book contains rules for modified card games, draught board games, Scrabble games and billiard table games.
20720.name: Alternative Games for Those Who Like  a Challenge

20721.name: Black Abyss
20721.description: Black Abyss is a space civilization game where players explore the galaxy for habitable planets and then scan the planets surface for beneficial terrain. Players will expand their empire by colonizing these planets and erecting buildings that best use the terrain and available space of each planet. A player will win by means of expansionary, militaristic, diplomatic, or scientific policies. The game features great details of empire building and fleet management.

20722.name: Alfredo's Food Fight
20722.description: Chef Alfredo is caught in the middle of a food fight! Grab your forks and fling your meatballs at the chef as he spins round and round. The first player to stick all of their meatballs on the chef wins! Have some food flinging fun… with no mess to cleanup! Game includes 12 meatballs, 4 flinging forks, and 1 spinning chef. Batteries not included.

20727.name: Facts In Acts
20727.description: "Who was blinded on the road to Damascus?" "Who asked to be tried in Rome?" Players answer these and other questions from the book of Acts as they match these four-sided dominoes. There are two complete sets of dominoes with one set emphasizing people, and the other set emphasizing places. Scriptural references and an answer key is included. 2-4 players. Ages 10 and up

20728.name: Grammar Mania
20728.description: This game reinforces the proper use of grammar as players identify and correct common grammatical errors. Over 700 sentences at three levels of difficulty are included. Throughout the game there are mistakes that are commonly made in the usage of adjectives, adverbs, questions, verbs, subject verb agreement, nouns, comparisons, superlatives, gerunds, infinitives, prepositions and more. A comprehensive answer key is included. Great for all English Language Learners (ESL) low intermediate to advanced and English grades 6-12.

20729.name: Bible Search
20729.description: Bible Search is a game of advance and block whose moves are generated by correctly answering the questions, of which there are 3 categories (Beginner, Intermediate and Advanced) in each of 2 sources, the Old Testament and the New Testament. Correctly answering a question generates 2 choices, a move to advance your pawn 1 space, or a block option which, if successful, allows you to block your opponent(s) progress, or chance missing a turn, advancing 2 spaces or moving back 2 if question incorrectly answered or advancing 1 space or moving back 2 if question incorrectly answered.

20730.name: Pisaturm
20730.description:
With 42 wooden rods ( six color groups of seven rods each) you should try to build as high a tower as possible. The color die decides if you have to put new rods on top of the tower or if you can pass the die to the next player without adding rods.

The game starts with 2 different colored rods placed parallel on the playing surface.

The first player rolls the die, if rolls the same color as one of the rods on top of the tower, he can pass the die to the next player.

If he rolls a different color as one of the two rods on top of the tower, he must place to new, differently colored, rods on top of the tower. These have to be placed at a right angle to the others.

You continue to play like this clockwise in turn.

The game is over when the tower collapses. The player who caused the crash loses the game.

20731.description:
From demo packet:

Capes & Cowls: Adventures in Wyrd City. It's super fun in 3 easy steps:


1. Recruit a team of heroes.
2. Send them into battle.
3. Clobber till content.


Wyrd City—where conflict lies in wait around every corner and the shadows are acrawl with mystery and adventure, where liberty wanes, government waxes, and a chosen few don capes and cowls to take their stand in a world gone Wyrd....

Capes & Cowls: The Superhero Board Game features 32 original Heroes (and/or villains, depending on your perspective) and several Crews of secondary characters, including Freedom Patrols, Liberty Bots, Diabloids, Arachnidrones, Darklings, thugs, and zombies. Each Hero is defined by personalized stats (Attack, Defense, Speed, and Vigor) and 3 unique Powers, while each Crew is defined by personalized stats and 1 unique Power. Altogether, Capes & Cowls provides over 75 characters with over 100 Powers.

Capes & Cowls is played on a unique Battleboard whose color- and number-coded spaces influence character abilities, modify power levels, and place strong emphasis on strategic and tactical play. Though certain game situations do require a roll of the Battle Die, skillful players will find themselves seldom relying on luck to determine the outcome of an action. In short, the player who recruits and manages his team of Heroes most wisely will nearly always prove the victor.

Capes & Cowls offers the following 3 modes of play:

1. Basic: In the Basic Game, each player recruits a team of 2 or 3 Heroes, deploys the team to the Battleboard, and dukes it out with his opponent’s team for a predetermined number of rounds. The victory goes to the player with the most Heroes left on the Battleboard at the end of the game.

2. Standard: The Standard Game allows each player to recruit a team of 4 or 5 Heroes, and introduces Scene Features such as Rooftops, Walls, and Trees, as well as Objects such as Boulders, Cars, and Mailboxes. These elements enrich the Battleboard environment and call for keener strategies and sharper tactics. The victory, as in the Basic Game, goes to the player with the most Heroes left on the Battleboard at the end of the game.

3. Adventure: The Adventure Game requires the players to select an Adventure from the Adventure Book. Each Adventure includes a full-color map for Battleboard setup, instructions for team recruitment, and special rules for playing the chosen Adventure, including team-specific goals and victory conditions. This mode of play incorporates Crew characters, special items, and plot devices that further define the Wyrd City universe and its colorful assortment of costumed denizens. The victory in an Adventure Game goes to the player whose team succeeds in fulfilling the predetermined goal of the Adventure.

In addition to the above modes of play, Capes & Cowls also allows for solitaire and multiplayer variations.

Wyrd City—where the “good guys” are bad, the “bad guys” are you, and the dress code is decidedly unusual.

Capes & Cowls: The Superhero Board Game! Let the battle begin!
20731.name: Capes & Cowls: The Superhero Board Game
boardgamepodcastepisode: I've Been Diced! episode 25: Genres that do or don't work as boardgames

20732.name: La conquista del Oeste
20732.description:
From the English instructions of play.

“The conquest of the west” reproduces the phases through which the colonists had to go, being first obliged to obtain their “traveling equipment” and then to set of into the unknown west.
This game does not belong to any specific time in XIX century and so people and historic events that really took place on different dates appear at same time.

From two to six players can take part, the winner being the one who first reached the points with a red circle inside, situated on the pacific coast.
First of all, each player must obtain this “traveling equipment” consisting of oxen, arms, provisions, and a wagon in the east, that is, on the green section of the board; then having acquired his equipment, the player enters the red section, which is the west, in order to attain his objective

NAC edition 1982
Factor Games edition 1990

20734.description:
Corsair Leader is based on the Hornet Leader II core game, but with some significant changes. The game focuses on the Marine F4U Corsairs in the Pacific. The 2 campaigns cover the Solomon Islands campaign that lasted from late 1942 to early 1944.

Also, the aircraft under your command center on the Corsair, but you also get to decide if you want to include Dauntlesses, B-25s, and B-17s as part of your group. Each aircraft has its own advantages and disadvantages. For example, the B-17s carry a lot of bombs and are hard to shoot down, but they are terrible versus naval targets and only moderately accurate against all but the largest of land targets.

The game also goes more in-depth on the tactical options you have while over target. Each turn, each aircraft can become "Offensive" which gives it an attack bonus, but also makes it easier to be attacked when it gets shot at. Likewise, aircraft can be "Defensive" which penalizes their own attacks and makes them harder to hit. "Slow" pilots can "Rush" their attack at a penalty and attack during the Fast pilot step, and "Fast" pilots can Wait and get a bonus if they attack during the Slow pilot step.

Like the other games in the "Leader" series, Corsair Leader is a solitaire game.

The game is published in both PDF and Vassel versions.

Other Leader series games by Dan Verssen
20734.name: Corsair Leader

20735.name: Rummy for Kids: Toy Story
20735.description:
